skin_conditions.name: Acne
treatments: Use a gentle, non-comedogenic cleanser twice daily
Use salicylic acid 0.5–2% exfoliant or cleanser
resources: American Academy of Dermatology (AAD) – Acne: https://www.aad.org/public/diseases/acne

skin_conditions.name: Eczema
treatments: Moisturize frequently with ceramide-rich creams or petroleum jelly
prevention: Avoid triggers like detergents and dust
resources: National Eczema Association – Skin Care: https://nationaleczema.org

skin_conditions.name: Melasma
treatments: Use gentle brighteners like niacinamide or vitamin C
prevention: Wear wide-brim hats and avoid strong sunlight
Avoid irritating scrubs or harsh treatments

skin_conditions.name: Seborrheic Dermatitis
treatments: Use medicated shampoos containing zinc pyrithione, selenium sulfide, or ketoconazole
Use lightweight moisturizers to avoid excessive greasiness
prevention: Avoid heavy oils or greasy products on scalp/face
resources: American Academy of Dermatology – Seborrheic Dermatitis: https://www.aad.org/public/diseases/a-z/seborrheic-dermatitis

skin_conditions.name: Rosacea
treatments: Apply mineral sunscreen (zinc oxide or titanium dioxide)
Use green-tinted moisturizers to reduce redness appearance
prevention: Avoid triggers: spicy foods, heat, hot drinks, alcohol, stress

skin_conditions.name: normal
treatments: No treatmnet found for normal skin.
prevention: Stay hydrated and eat a balanced diet.
